title: Changing floating point numbers in property tree

content.raw: When changing floating point numbers in the property tree (e.g. when trying to change the pose of an object or step size of the simulator) you can't simply add digits to the right of the decimal point because the input seems to be restricted to six decimal places. You first need to "make space" by removing trailing zeros or other digits. This restriction does not prevent you from adding numbers to the left of the decimal point though or when modifying integer numbers.
content.html: When changing floating point numbers in the property tree (e.g. when trying to change the pose of an object or step size of the simulator) you can't simply add digits to the right of the decimal point because the input seems to be restricted to six decimal places. You first need to "make space" by removing trailing zeros or other digits. This restriction does not prevent you from adding numbers to the left of the decimal point though or when modifying integer numbers.
